misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No misconception detected (correct notional machine for array shifting)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they must save the last element, shift the rest of the array right by copying from left to right (actually from high index down to low), then put the saved last element into index 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There isn’t a notional-machine gap visible here. The code reflects an accurate model of how array assignment works in Java: assignments overwrite values, so you must preserve the value that would be overwritten (the last element) before shifting; and you must iterate from right to left to avoid overwriting values you still need to copy.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: No error; produces correct output for the stated task (including handling n==0).
